Literature Review: The integration of clinical trials methodology into health care quality improvement (QI) and systems interventions has the potential to revolutionize the way we approach improvement efforts. Despite the growing recognition of the value of randomized controlled trials (RCTs) in QI, rapid randomized trials remain a relatively underutilized approach. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the historical underpinnings of rapid RCTs in QI, discuss the benefits and challenges of implementing this approach, and highlight lessons learned from running multiple rapid trials in a health care system setting.
